website_summaries.verdict: A great electric extractor with a sturdy build that holds the frames stable.
pros: Electric motor helps cut down on the work
Strong, well made cage to hold the frames
Goes together quickly and spins smoothly
cons: The construction on this model could be better quality

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, great price.
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly for us last fall. We had been borrowing a manual extractor and harvesting day had turned from fun to too much work. This gem works great. Half the price of anything comparable made domestically. Quality appears to be more than adequate for the hobbyist with a dozen hives. Will update after we use it fall of 2016. As with all tangential extractors: Spin out one side of frames on moderate speed. Turn frames over and spin out on full speed. Turn back to first side and spin out on full speed. This keeps the foundations from busting out of the frames.
customer_reviews.author: Charles H.

customer_reviews.title: Thrilled
customer_reviews.text: We are thrilled with this purchase. We had been borrowing a hand crank extractor and decided to purchase a motorized one. At half the price of many other motorized ones, we decided to take a chance on this one and are glad we did. We are a small Apiary with only 4 hives. It was so nice to put them in and let them spin. We did bolt it down to a solid table which we had, rather than using the legs provided. This made it more stable and the correct height for us. I arrived in great condition and all assembled except the legs.
customer_reviews.author: Nebz

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't believe that I found this for the price. We were very pleased to receive this extractor. It came much quicker than expected and we have used it several times already this summer. It is great to be able to place 8 frames at a time and it works so quickly we have save a lot of time. The only thing that we have found is that the legs don't seem to be very sturdy for the size of the unit. We bolted it to 3 6x6 pieces of lumber that we had laying around to help it from vibrating so bad while running. Overall, we are VERY satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tina H

customer_reviews.title: Must be Balalnced
customer_reviews.text: If you have a small bee yard and medium or shallow foundation, this is perfect. It works well if you can get the frames balanced. Probably best to mount the tank on something. Better to cut the capping off than to roll. I wonder if having the gate underneath, if it would drain better? Unless you take the motor off and turn the barrel upside down, you can not get the last cup or so out. Is it worth it???
customer_reviews.author: j2kwalk

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: We debated with spending more and weren't sure about the brand, but it turned out to work really well. It's a little wobbly and needs a sturdy base but that seems like the case with all of them. When we got it one the foot pieces was broke. We contacted support and they sent a new leg right away. We've used it three times now and it's been great everytime!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use.  Easy to Clean Up.
customer_reviews.text: After harvesting 10 gallons of honey by crush and strain, we opted to purchase this model. It was the preferred model used by a beekeeper who extracts for several families. We saw it used to extract several supers and then purchased our own. If you have the space, build a wooden base and affix the feet to it...that eliminates all wobble. We chose to spin the kitchen without the base...so it just took a few extra minutes per load to get the most honey out of the frames. Please with value and function!
customer_reviews.author: Nona Evans

customer_reviews.title: Unstable and stopped working quickly
customer_reviews.text: It's a substantial product, and didn't feel cheap, but two main issues: 1. When the motor first was turned on, it worked fine, but the the rest of the product can't actually sustain a quick spin of any sort because the pieces aren't terribly well fit to each other. I knew that might be an issue while putting it together, as a lot of the parts had multiple holes in them and didn't quite fit together perfectly. 2. The motor stopped working pretty quickly. It now spins about one rotation every 4-5 seconds, so obviously can't be used to separate honey. Currently I'm manually spinning it with stick, so it's just a very expensive bucket.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: As good as MannLake or Dadant for a very fair price.
customer_reviews.text: After assembling and using this extractor - I can confidently give it five stars. I have used many others from Dadant and Mannlake - this is very solid and it takes care of the comb. I didn't mount it and it did shake when load was uneven, but that is an easy fix. I used medium frames. love the auto stop and the clear covers. I waited years to buy an extractor and I am glad I waited and this is it. I keep about 10 hives year round.
customer_reviews.author: Sirf

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I was so disappointed with this spinner...left in the box until we pulled honey frames...sadly the nightmare began...1. Had to make adjustment on the small metal piece that clicks the stop and go button on lid...metal piece wrong place and to short. 2. Legs will need to be strengthened 3. Worst of all each set of frames took 15 min or longer to spin out and not spun clean...motor over heats. We had to stop and wait the finish the next day...for the amount of money they get for this item it’s not worth it...we had it to long in the box to return...we just thru 300. In the fire...
customer_reviews.author: Paula davis

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Worked well, just as described. Pretty good price for an electric extractor. Easy setup. Tall enough for a 5 gallon bucket and filter to fit below the honey gate without having to lift it onto a platform. Inserting the frames was little bit of a tight squeeze without scraping the top and making a mess, but we got the hang of it and adjusted well after a few frames. Legs are sturdy. I would definitely purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Bee-utiful
customer_reviews.text: 5th year beekeeper with 5 hives and this was our first honey extractor - we were doing it a primitive way before. It makes a world, of a difference! Pretty easy to put together, shakes a little when it’s spinning fast but it does a great job. Poured out easily & cleaned easily. This took less time, made less mess and our bees don’t have to rebuild comb now.
customer_reviews.author: Holland McGraw

customer_reviews.title: Where has this been all my life??
customer_reviews.text: I love this spinner. After using a 2 frame hand crank for 3 years I decided to upgrade. I bought this one and I am so happy I did. This spinner and I spun 1004 pounds of honey in 2019. It never missed a beat! Do yourself a favor and buy this spinner.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Hudspeth

customer_reviews.title: Broken and no customer service
customer_reviews.text: The basket in the tub rubs against side when spinning, so much so that it bogs down motor and won’t spin. While that is bad enough, VIVO does not respond to my request for what to do. Their initial response was “it sounds like a defective tub, send us a video and pictures”. I sent video and pictures as requested and now cannot get a response from them. Unfortunately I’m out $400 with no recourse. I recommend you look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Memememe

customer_reviews.title: Works ok, but had to pay tax  on a business expense
customer_reviews.text: The company did not follow up on their commitment to refund the tax. If this is for a business, try to get some type of discount code up-front. I’ve gotten the run-around, sent my tax exempt card, filed out their tax exempt forms, going on 3 months and nothing. Other then that, it’s not a bad product for the price, just need to bolt it to the ground somehow or else it may lose control at high speeds.
customer_reviews.author: M. C. Mullins

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing product
customer_reviews.text: After so many positive reviews I have to wonder if the company changed its supplier. The spot welds on the brackets to attach the legs are awful. One was hanging off the drum right out of the box and I inspected the others. It looked like they'd snap off in my hand. I considered using this without the legs but for the price decided to send it back. Way over priced for the quality
customer_reviews.author: Michele Caton

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it so far
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed to say that my extractor arrived today missing many items: Missing: -Honey gate with lid -Hex nut -O ring -Leg bolts -washers -Clear lids -m4 bolts -m4 nuts This is extremely disappointing. I will update this review depending if the seller mails me the parts.
customer_reviews.author: wildchicken

customer_reviews.title: It is easy to disassemble for cleaning
customer_reviews.text: I plan to use this tomorrow. I have 2 medium supers of honey. This unit takes 8 medium frames laterally at a time if I choose to do that many. But I am a newby and hope to see it just work and save me some time. I will post more later. It is easy to disassemble for cleaning. So its been a year and I have harvested 28 gallons of honey so far last year and this year. This thing does all the work. I screw it to some 2x4s for stability when doing 8 frames. Extremely happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: HVEngr1

customer_reviews.title: A great plus as I have drawn comb for next season
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic- well worth the money. It extracts the honey quickly and completely and leaves the comb intact. A great plus as I have drawn comb for next season. Assembly is not complicated. Cleans easily. Well made. Note: bolt to blocks of wood so it does not "dance" across the floor.
customer_reviews.author: consumer

customer_reviews.title: Good value, nice quality
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a very nice extractor. I can't believe how FAST this shipped!!! It arrived with good packaging, and undamaged. I would say it does not look as heavy duty as the Dadant extractor I borrowed for a couple of years, BUT since I am just a hobbyist with 2 hives, should be more than adequate, and the price is more hobbyist-friendly for sure. I'll have to wait for a month or two to see how this works in use, but it sure looks like a well built piece of equipment, and so far VERY HAPPY with it!
customer_reviews.author: R. Kang

customer_reviews.title: maybe try something else
customer_reviews.text: Tub is good, unit is very quiet. Motor mount was put together entirely backwards. All screws pointed down hitting frames. Had to resemble entirely. Basket sits to high up in tub , which ends of frames come in contact with top housing using Mann lake frames. I have to fix basket height by cutting central rod so it won't hit top any more. Very poor quality control. This could be a great until if they would stop and fix these major issues. Paid a lot of money, didn't expect this to be so poor.
customer_reviews.author: Bill McCracken

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I bought one 3 yrs ago with a 1 yr warrenty, I used it once & it quit working, just under a yr I contacted company & they replace3d motor, I used it for the 2nd time & it quit working again. $350 for a piece of junk
customer_reviews.author: James M. Longfellow

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. I processed over 200 lbs so far. I put wood spacers on bottom of feet so a 5 gal bucket fit under it. The gate is a little too high. Great to have electric motor. Great value for the price. Packaging was great too as it was dropped during shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Great extractor, great price!
customer_reviews.text: This is our first extractor and works great! Applaud the customer service too, our lid broke (caution on tightening screws), and they sent a replacement immediately for free!! We have the 4 frame, but can actually fit 8 honey super frames in at a time. You should also mount this to some kind of table, platform, as it will shake all over floor otherwise. Even if frames are balanced, will move around. We secure the legs to plywood.
customer_reviews.author: morlauren

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t used yet for extraction, but after assembly it does run without issue. Assembly went fairly smooth although instructions did not mention that removal of motor and frame racks would be needed in order to clean tub and to install honey gate. Top cover did have small stress fractures where the preassembled metal tabs for automatic shutoff were screwed into plexiglass cover as if screws were over torqued when assembled.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customerlastfling

customer_reviews.title: Fast, efficient, and worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: An excellent alternative to a hand-crank honey extractor!! My kit was missing a screw and small plate that operated the safety switch, but their customer service was very friendly and they sent me out the parts quickly. It is definitely worth the money!!
customer_reviews.author: Rob Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Crap spinner
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy this. There support team sucks, If u have an issue they will keep Blowing u off so u can’t get anything fixed, Mine basket shaft was bent and they won’t replace it. I would look for a different company to buy from..
customer_reviews.author: don brinkman

customer_reviews.title: Vivo Extractor
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, easy to use. Motor is quiet. Extraction of honey went smoothly. Had a problem with motor overheating but company acted quickly to resolve the issue that was fast and timely.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Home Run!
customer_reviews.text: Good product! Very easy to use and cleans up well afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: CJC

customer_reviews.title: great customer service
customer_reviews.text: want follow up my last post to say that vivo has excellent customer service. the reps are responsive and helpful and pleasant. my issue with the first extractor was resolved with a free replacement. i had problems with the second because it didn't come assembled properly, but we worked it out. i have no complaints with this company. thank you.
customer_reviews.author: j

customer_reviews.title: Better than hand cranking
customer_reviews.text: adjustment between motor connection with the spinner- the screw they used did not tighten the head tight enough so this will take a little time to adjust so you don't burn up your motor--other than that it saved a lot of time and energy.
customer_reviews.author: Jere Bibb

customer_reviews.title: Nice parts and pieces but rough design and manufacture
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice sized home extractor but as stated in other reviews I read before making my purchase, it is not good out of the box. If you've ever worked with a premium model, this one will disappoint. Your first clue should be the demo video in which they show the honey frames, for radial extraction, being loaded in the machine backwards. It was obviously designed by people who don't really know the "how and why" of what it needs to do. Purchase it, knowing it will need some modifications to work well or at least some tweaking to do the intended job, reasonably well.
customer_reviews.author: deeltz

customer_reviews.title: I'm very pleased so far with this product
customer_reviews.text: I have only used it to extract honey from 8 medium frames, thus far. It works very well. The machine ran smoothly with basically no vibration. It came with hold down bolts, so I was expecting the machine to bounce around or at least walk across the floor, but it didn't! I'm very pleased with this product, so far. It was a good price.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Snyder

customer_reviews.title: A great, powered extractor
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to the motorized version and it has performed very well. The biggest advantage is more honey is pulled from the frames with way less effort. Well built and handles 8 medium frames with not problem.
customer_reviews.author: David Lenweaver

customer_reviews.title: Well made, easy to use, love it.
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this product. Easy to put together. Works great. My husband glued carpet to a board and bolted it down. It works wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not sure,
customer_reviews.text: Smells like moth balls!! Hope after cleaning it a few times it will go away and not effect the honey.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Blackshire

customer_reviews.title: Works great 👍
customer_reviews.text: The plexiglass was cracked at at delivery. Some of the pieces were loose inside😤. It did go together easy and works great 👍. I just set it out for the bees to clean it after I am finished collecting all of the honey that I can. Do not need to use highest speeds. Worked perfect with a little patience!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a huge fan...buy a RADIAL extractor instead.
customer_reviews.text: So, I bought this in high hopes that this was an economical solution, but was more trouble than it was worth due to the setup of the inside of the spinner. Because it is NOT RADIAL, you have to HALF spin out one side of the frames, and then flip then over, spin out the other side, and then go back and spin out the first side again. More time consuming than it is worth.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product at awesome price
customer_reviews.text: Used this a few times this year. No complaints at all. Shipping was fast and product arrived in perfect condition. I would suggest to also buy a tube of food grade grease for the ball bearing.
customer_reviews.author: The Flanigans

customer_reviews.title: great customer service
customer_reviews.text: i love this extractor!!! I did have a problem with motor after using for the fall harvest but i called customer service and they sent me out a replacement right away. supurb customer service agent dylan was awesome!!! Thanks!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap parts and will not last
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. Do not waste your money. Shaft was bent. Cheap plastic pieces that broke after spinning 8 frames.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela A.

customer_reviews.title: Came dented
customer_reviews.text: Think this will work for quite a while. My only issue is that it appears during shipping it was dropped resulting in a few dents in the side of the stainless drum. Doesnt look as pretty but it works.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Renner

customer_reviews.title: GREAT HONEY EXTRACTOR FOR HOBBYISTS
customer_reviews.text: The 3-frame extractor is easy to assemble, well built, runs quietly, and is easy to clean and store. I was able to efficiently extract 60 honey frames in one day. I will definitely upgrade to a larger VIVO extractor as my bee colonies expand.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B

customer_reviews.title: A great product!!
customer_reviews.text: Far exceeded our expectations!! Great product for a great price. Very quick delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Patty L

customer_reviews.title: Good unit for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great unit for the money. One thing make sure you put something under the feet or it will scratch the floor. It took the paint off my basement floor. Other than that good unit.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for the price.
customer_reviews.text: The Vivo worked well tangentially with four shallow frames but did not work well radially with 8 shallow frames. Also has some sharp edges but for the price just cant beat it compared to mannlake and dadant. Extracted about 70 frames off 3 hives.
customer_reviews.author: Moushaffa

customer_reviews.title: Price is right
customer_reviews.text: Not disappointed in this extractor at all. Shipped w/out any damage, and worked like a charm. Only thing we had to do was secure it to a platform so it didn't walk away. Did the job for us and we are very happy.
customer_reviews.author: G. Kosydar

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded from hand crank, Love it!
customer_reviews.text: All extractors that we have had require a good system to fasten them to the floor. This one is the same. Without that they rattle and shake. Move up speed slowly.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda B

customer_reviews.title: Poorly constructed
customer_reviews.text: Purchased less than a year ago. Used twice. Shaft broke at top of spinner. No response from seller and now over $400 wasted on this product. Do not buy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Pretty decent extractor for the price. I would buy it again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: ~AndyJoy01~

customer_reviews.title: VIVOmelectric extractor
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for extracting honey. We used it the first time this week. Would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: happycamper

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Very good product for the price. Expected it to be of lesser quality and was pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Scott P.

customer_reviews.title: VIVO New Electric Four 4 Frame
customer_reviews.text: Great product! We used it a couple of times & very satisfied with our purchase! We recommend this honey extractor to anyone interested in purchasing one! Thank you VIVO!
customer_reviews.author: Valentina

customer_reviews.title: Electric is the way to go!!!
customer_reviews.text: Electric, 4 frame faster!!! We had a hand crank it was cheaper but broke after a year! Spend the extra money and due your self a favor, saving time!! Vivo Electric its Awesome!!! 5 stars....
customer_reviews.author: maureen oday

customer_reviews.title: Was exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't have gotten a better deal from any beekeeping supplier. Was so easy to put together in minutes.
customer_reviews.author: L. Sable

customer_reviews.title: Painless to use
customer_reviews.text: We received and assembled it on day 1 and extracted 5 gallons of honey the next day. Peice of cake and sooooo much easier than using the manual spinner.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Great extractor for the money
customer_reviews.text: Although I haven’t used it yet, I see no problems or issues with this extractor. It delivered a week earlier than I expected and in perfect condition. Assembly time was about 30 minutes. It will extract 4 deep frames tangentially or 8 medium or shallow frames radially. Really happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Impractical
customer_reviews.text: The screws would come off every time I turned it on.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: No need to pay high retail prices at my local bee supply shops when this great extractor is available.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Vann

customer_reviews.title: Sweet purchase
customer_reviews.text: The honey gate is in a horrible place and it is a little difficult to clean, for these reasons only I cannot give it 5 stars. It worked fantastic. Very happy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi1611

customer_reviews.title: This extractor is a wonderful machine that works very well.
customer_reviews.text: I would suggest this machine to anyone for it is a great extractor that does a ver good job of extracting and it seem to have very good balance if loaded correctly. I was able to extract as fast as I could uncap the comb.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Delivered Damaged
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately mine came with a big dent on the side of it:-(. I requested a replacement. Hopefully it come very soon Bmc I have honey frames pulled.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This extractor works wonderfully. The electric, adjustable motor is great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too dented to be able to spin.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived badly dented. Drum was too far out of round to turn. Do your research and find something more sturdy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best cheap extractor, bolt the legs to a pallet or sheet of plywood before you use it and it will last a long time. The other Chinese stuff is just to cheaply made!
customer_reviews.author: sherry james

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: Delivered in prefect condition. Extracted honey perfectly and saved us lots of time and frustration. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Great machine! The radial option with mediums takes a long time to get the bottom of the frame and is much faster to handle and rotate 4 at a time tangentially.
customer_reviews.author: cody

customer_reviews.title: The quality is compatible with the price.
customer_reviews.text: I noticed that the unit had several dents when I unpacked it but seem to work fine. I did not have time to ask for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: B. Porter

customer_reviews.title: Sorry welds
customer_reviews.text: Legs fell off the first time we used it. Welds should be screwed.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis K.

customer_reviews.title: Little spinner did 100+ gallons
customer_reviews.text: Great little honey extractor for the money. Keep it balanced. Locktite your bolts. I spun 100+ gallons with this in the 2020 season with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Timm Ott/ Post Falls Honey Co.

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my dad, uncle, and friends to use for their bee keeping hobby. They are estatic and love using it!
customer_reviews.author: Mandee

customer_reviews.title: Good money spent.
customer_reviews.text: Must be bolted to the floor as the motor is very powerful causing the machine to shake if not bolted down.
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen Hinson

customer_reviews.title: Balancing the frames is the key.
customer_reviews.text: Great product just turn speed ups and down slowly and smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Mohatt

customer_reviews.title: Better quality stainless steel than expected
customer_reviews.text: Well-made. Better quality stainless steel than expected. All parts arrived in great shape. Assembly was minor. Appreciated design touches: magnets to holds lids open, legs tall enough for 5-gallon bucket, conical base allows extraction of a fair amount of honey before emptying, straightforward disassembly to remove basket for cleaning. Just extracted this weekend and it worked admirably. Very small shudder when increasing speed, but didn’t affect operation, which performed like a champ. Great value for hobbyist with more colonies than I want to hand-crank, but don’t want/need to spend $1000+ on extractor. Looking forward to many years of seasonal use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good for small honey keeper
customer_reviews.text: husband wanted for honey harvesting , says works great , he is satisfied with this!!!
customer_reviews.author: Shop to drop

customer_reviews.title: Good product, good customer service
customer_reviews.text: Good product for the money, basket is SOLID, tub is slightly thin but doesnt effect the useability. Solid company and solid product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.  Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: It's a great price for an electric honey extractor. No complaints. Easy to use. Easy to clean. Easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hadley

customer_reviews.title: price was right
customer_reviews.text: smooth operation. thin metal but expected for price. i will be happy if it lasts a few years.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Mulligan

customer_reviews.title: Be Sure to Assemble Correctly
customer_reviews.text: Just Extracted 80 Quarts of Honey with this . No Problems
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Runs nice, dose a good job for an inexpensive extractor
customer_reviews.text: Runs nice,dose a good job for an inexpensive extractor,easy to disassemble and clean.
customer_reviews.author: mark wilson

customer_reviews.title: As advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and operate. Tends to wobble at high speeds so probably need to mount it to a base.
customer_reviews.author: Tom T.

customer_reviews.title: works ok
customer_reviews.text: worked great but needs to be higher to fit 5 gallon bucket under spout other wise it worked fine
customer_reviews.author: joefish

customer_reviews.title: Read the directions
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase I made this year, works awesome. Just be sure to read the setup instructions before you try to run it.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas

customer_reviews.title: I would spend a little bit more money and a better built extractor
customer_reviews.text: I have extracted 30 boxes, the bushing between the motor and the basket with bad.And now the feet are breaking off!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Flowers

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. However on the first extraction the shaft came loose from the motor. Working on repairing it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I ordered early because out of season cost is cheaper product easy to assemble and works
customer_reviews.text: Quick shipping product works well would be nice to include parts list and instructions but overall very satisfied Vivo even sent email to contact them for parts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... my extractor a few times now and it worked wonderfully. It is a little difficult for me to ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used my extractor a few times now and it worked wonderfully. It is a little difficult for me to clean the tub and there is one spot where if I have the tub filled with water that it leaks. However, when I am extracting honey it does not get that full so it is not a problem for me.
customer_reviews.author: drau

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The customer service is super amazing. Love the product and highly recommend it. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: wolfie

customer_reviews.title: Its almost that time to pull the honey I will ...
customer_reviews.text: Its almost that time to pull the honey I will let you know how it works in July, we have 23 bee hives
customer_reviews.author: Robbie C.

product_meta.title: VIVO Large Electric 2 Frame Stainless Steel Honey Extractor with Strainer, Honeycomb Drum Spinner (BEE-V002E)
feature_bullets: VIVO ELECTRIC HONEY EXTRACTOR - With this product’s quiet 120V AC Motor, extracting honey has never been easier! The honey gate is elevated 15.25” from the floor to help keep the drum clear of extracted honey and allow room for a 5-gallon bucket underneath the gate.

STEEL DRUM - The stainless steel drum on this 2-frame honey extractor is 24” tall and 15” in diameter, perfect for extracting a lot of honey at one time. The gate opening rests a mere 0.5” above the bottom of the barrel, so you can easily get most of the honey out of the extractor without having to tip it forward.
FRAMES - This honey extractor fits shallow, medium, and deep frames with metal gears enclosed to keep them clean of honey.
CLEAR LID - With a clear plastic lid, you can easily watch your honey as it spins.
WE’VE GOT YOU COVERED - This honey extractor comes with a limited 1-year Manufacturer warranty as well as friendly tech support to help with any questions or concerns.
